etymology.description: Pictogram — picture of a plant stalk; clearer in older forms; similar to 來 but unrelated to 釆; later gave 株 and 硃.
etymology.interpretation: Depicts a stalk of grain with a head and leaves, representing cereal crops in general. Early forms make the plant shape more obvious; despite resembling 來, it has a separate origin and later served as a basis for forms in characters like 株 and 硃.

examples.chinese: 田里长满了禾苗(田裡長滿了禾苗)。
examples.pinyin: Tián lǐ zhǎng mǎn le hé miáo.
examples.english: The field is full of grain seedlings.

examples.chinese: 秋天田野里的禾熟了(秋天田野裡的禾熟了)。
examples.pinyin: Qiūtiān tiányě lǐ de hé shú le.
examples.english: In autumn, the grain crops in the fields have ripened.

examples.chinese: 禾本科作物需要充足的阳光(禾本科作物需要充足的陽光)。
examples.pinyin: Hé běnkē zuòwù xūyào chōngzú de yángguāng.
examples.english: Crops of the grass family need plenty of sunlight.
